item.title: Fanatical $12 Charity Bundle - Warhammer Rogue Trader, SteamWorld Build, And 13 More Games
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/fanatical-12-charity-bundle-warhammer-rogue-trader-steamworld-build-and-13-more-games/1100-6527535/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Fanatical's latest charity bundle includes 15 games for a minimum donation of $12. Not only is this a tremendous deal, but you'll be supporting a great cause. All proceeds from the bundle go to Movember, a charity focused on raising awareness for and funding men's health initiatives. Most of the games in the Movember Game 'Stache Charity Bundle are marked as verified or playable on Steam Deck. While you're checking out the bundle, make sure to browse Fanatical's massive Birthday Bash, which features deals on thousands of PC games and is one of the retailer's largest sales each year.

Movember Game 'Stache Charity Bundle

  • SteamWorld Build (Steam Deck playable)
  • Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader (Steam Deck verified)
  • The Gunk (Steam Deck playable)
  • American Truck Simulator (Steam Deck verified)
  • Chivalry 2 (Steam Deck playable)
  • The Escapists (Steam Deck playable)
  • Doors: Paradox (Steam Deck playable)
  • Panzer Corps 2
  • Hello Neighbor
  • For The King (Steam Deck playable)
  • Inertial Drift (Steam Deck verified)
  • Isonzo - Movember Handlbar DLC
  • Filthy Animals | Heist Simulator
  • Eastside Hockey Manager
  • The Corridor (Steam Deck playable)
  • The Little Acre (Steam Deck playable)

There are quite a few highlights here, starting with Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader, which retails for $50 on its own, making this bundle worthwhile even if you only want that. Rogue Trader. is a turn-based tactical combat game played from an isometric perspective. It takes place within the systems of the Koronus Expanse and lets you assemble a motley crew of allies to help you survive in this grim slice of the cosmos.

Another notable inclusion is SteamWorld Build, a base-building spin-off set in Thunderful Development's colorful world of steam-powered robots. This entry lets you build your own town above ground and mine for precious resources beneath it. The SteamWorld series was created by Image & Form, an indie studio that became part of the larger Thunderful Group in 2020.

The studio's final release under the Image & Form umbrella, The Gunk, is also included in the charity bundle. The Gunk is a clean-'em-up 3D adventure set on a newly discovered planet teeming with parasitic ooze. You'll have to use cutting-edge cleaning equipment to remove the infestation.

Chilvary 2 is also a solid option here, especially if you're in the mood for a Kingdom of Heaven simulator. It's a first-person PvP game inspired by medieval movie battles, so expect siege warfare and hard-hitting combat with armored foes.

More Fanatical Bundles

Two other notable Fanatical bundles you can check out right now are the Build Your Own Prestige and Supreme Bundles. The Supreme Bundle is especially good, as you can grab a pair of games normally priced at $30 or more for $12.50 each, including RoboCop: Rogue City, Wild Bastards, Dungeons of Hinterberg, and High on Life. The more you grab, the better the discount. If you pick five or more games, the price drops to $11 per game.

Meanwhile, console gamers will want to pay a visit to Best Buy, as the site is hosting a buy one, get one 50% off game promotion. Hundreds of PS5, Xbox Series X, and Switch physical games are on sale, including recent releases like Metaphor: ReFantazio, Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2, Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth, and Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth.

Disclosure: GameSpot and Fanatical are both owned by Fandom.

Darryn Bonthuys on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Pokemon Go November 2024 Events: Raids, Spotlight Hours, Community Day, And More
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/pokemon-go-november-2024-events-raids-spotlight-hours-community-day-and-more/1100-6527544/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

A new month has arrived, which means a new slate of events to look forward to in Pokemon Go. The mobile game has a variety of activities lined up for the final month of its Max Out season, including new Spotlight Hours and a Mankey Community Day.

That's not all that's happening this month. On top of that, a handful of legendary Pokemon from the Galar region will make an encore appearance in raid battles, including Regieleki and Regidrago. Origin Forme Dialga and Palkia will also appear as raid bosses this month, giving you another chance to add these rare legendaries to your collection.

We've put together a rundown of all the biggest events happening in Pokemon Go this month below.

Table of Contents [hide]

  • November Raid Schedule
    • Max Battles
    • Five-star Raids
    • Mega Raids
    • Shadow Raids
  • November Spotlight Hours
  • Harvest Festival
  • Mankey Community Day
  • Simply Groundbreaking
  • Into The Wild
  • Pokemon Go Wild Area: Global
  • Max Out: Finale

November Raid Schedule

Pokemon Go is bringing back a handful of legendary and Mega Pokemon for its November raids.

This month, players will have another chance to catch Origin Forme Dialga, Origin Forme Palkia, and other legendaries in five-star raids, while Mega Manectric, Mega Beedrill, and Mega Salamence will appear in Mega raids.

On top of that, the Kanto and Galar starters will be available once again in Max Battles all month long, while Shadow Suicune will appear as a special Shadow raid boss during weekends. You can see November's full raid schedule below:

Max Battles

November 1-December 1

  • Bulbasaur
  • Charmander
  • Squirtle
  • Grookey
  • Scorbunny
  • Sobble

Five-star Raids

November 4-18

  • Lugia

November 18-27

  • Origin Forme Dialga
  • Origin Forme Palkia

November 27-December 3

  • Zacian
  • Zamazenta
  • Regieleki
  • Regidrago

Mega Raids

November 4-11

  • Mega Manectric

November 11-18

  • Mega Salamence

November 18-27

  • Mega Beedrill
  • Mega Ampharos

November 27-December 3

  • Mega Altaria

Shadow Raids

Every weekend in November

  • Shadow Suicune

November Spotlight Hours

Pokemon Go's Spotlight Hour events return every week in November with a new batch of Pokemon to catch and bonuses to earn.

Every Tuesday evening from 6-7 PM local time, a select species of Pokemon will appear in the wild more frequently than usual, making this a good opportunity to fill out your Pokedex and stock up on candy. On top of that, a particular bonus will be active during the event, such as increased XP for catching or evolving Pokemon.

You can see November's full Spotlight Hour schedule below:

November 5

  • Featured Pokemon: Surskit
  • Bonus: 2x transfer candy

November 12

  • Featured Pokemon: Smoliv
  • Bonus: 2x evolution XP

November 19

  • Featured Pokemon: Teddiursa and Combee
  • Bonus: 2x catch Stardust

November 26

  • Featured Pokemon: Joltik
  • Bonus: 2x catch XP

Harvest Festival

Pokemon Go's first major event of November is the Harvest Festival, which runs from November 7-12.

Throughout the event, autumn-themed Pokemon like Oddish, Hoppip, Bunnelby, and Smoliv will appear in the wild more frequently than usual, while Alolan Exeggutor, super size Pumpkaboo, and Snorlax will appear more frequently when you use a Mossy Lure Module.

In addition to the featured Pokemon, a few special bonuses will be active throughout the event. You'll earn double candy for catching Pokemon, and there will be increased odds of encountering a shiny Pumpkaboo. There will also be new Field Research tasks and Collection Challenges to complete.

You can see the full list of featured Pokemon below:

Wild Encounters

  • Oddish
  • Exeggcute
  • Hoppip
  • Sunkern
  • Miltank
  • Zigzagoon
  • Bunnelby
  • Pumpkaboo
  • Smoliv

Drawn to Mossy Lure Modules

  • Alolan Exeggutor
  • Snorlax
  • Pumpkaboo
  • Smoliv

Pokemon Go's November Community Day is set for November 10 and features the fighting-type Pokemon Mankey.

From 2-5 PM local time, Mankey will appear in the wild more frequently than usual, while its evolved form Primeape will appear in gyms as a special four-star raid boss from 5-10 PM local time. Any Primeape that you evolve into Annihilape before 10 PM local time will also learn the Charged Attack Rage Fist upon evolving.

On top of that, a slate of bonuses will be available throughout the event. As usual, any Lure Modules or Incense you use will last for three hours rather than their usual durations, and you'll earn triple XP and double candy each time you catch a Pokemon.

As a special limited-time bonus, Pokemon Go is also making it easier to evolve Primeape into Annihilape. During this event, you can evolve Primeape after catching 20 fighting-type Pokemon while Primeape is set as your buddy.

Simply Groundbreaking

Pokemon Go's next big event of November is called Simply Groundbreaking, and it runs from November 15-17. More details about the event will be announced later this month.

Into The Wild

Pokemon Go is keeping the fall festivities rolling with an Into the Wild event from November 18-22. More details will be announced closer to the event.

Pokemon Go Wild Area: Global

Pokemon Go is hosting a global Wild Area event from November 23-24. More details about the event will be revealed later this month.

Max Out: Finale

Pokemon Go is capping off its Max Out season with a special finale event from November 27-December 1. More will be revealed closer to the event.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Black Ops 6 Patch Notes For November 1 Update Detail The Latest Changes
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/black-ops-6-patch-notes-for-november-1-update-detail-the-latest-changes/1100-6527546/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 received an update today, November 1, introducing a number of changes and fixes across multiplayer and Zombies.

For multiplayer, the update fixes an issue that caused some players to see a black screen when loading into a multiplayer or Zombies match. Beyond that, Black Ops 6's multiplayer mode has removed the Lowtown map from the Infected playlist and fixed an issue in free-for-all matches that caused scoring to be based on total score, rather than elimination points, as it's meant to be.

Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6 Campaign Review

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Black Ops 6's Omni-movement system gets some attention in the update, too, as the update fixes an issue in the Search & Destroy mode that allowed players to slide "too far" when defusing or planting the bomb. It's expected that players will continue to try to find new ways to use Omni-movement to their advantage.

In the meantime, players have discovered flashbanging teammates earns you XP.

For Zombies, the November 1 patch addresses an exploit that allowed players to activate timed GobbleGums more than once. The patch also resolves an issue that allowed players to utilize Tactical Raft to block zombies. What's more, the game had an issue where players could get stuck in Spectator mode, but that's now been fixed.

You can see all the changes for Black Ops 6 multiplayer and Zombies below, as shared by Activision. For more, you can check out GameSpot's Black Ops 6 campaign, multiplayer, and Zombies reviews. You can also watch The Replacer have some fun on Jeopardy in a silly promo video for Black Ops 6.

Friday, November 1, 2024

GLOBAL

Stability

  • Addressed an issue where some players may encounter a black screen when loading into a public or private match for both Multiplayer and Zombies.

Settings

  • Resolved an issue when trying to select DLSS or DLAA in the upscaling options.

UI

  • Resolved an issue with the unlock notification for Diamond Mastery Badges.

MULTIPLAYER

Maps

  • Removed Lowtown from Infected map pool.

Modes

  • Added Infected to Private Match mode select.
  • Resolved an issue in Free-For-All where scoring was based on total score rather than the number of elimination points.
  • Resolved an issue in Search and Destroy where players could slide too far while defusing or planting the bomb.

Weapons

  • Resolved an issue with the Slug attachment on Shotguns dealing incorrect damage.

Progression

  • Resolved an issue where challenges requiring Dive Kills were not awarded properly.

Stability

  • Resolved an issue with stability when using the UAV.
  • Resolved an issue with stability in Infected when earning medals.
  • Resolved an issue with stability when using the Vigilance perk.

ZOMBIES

Gameplay

  • Closed an exploit that allowed players to re-activate timed GobbleGums.

Enemies

  • Specials and Elites killed by scorestreaks will no longer drop items.

Terminus

  • Closed an exploit that allowed players to block zombie pathing with the Tactical Raft.

Liberty Falls

  • Resolved an issue that prevented Scorestreaks from being used after completing the Main Quest.
  • Resolved an issue that would leave the player in spectator mode when dying after completing the Main Quest.

Stability

  • Resolved an issue with stability when changing field upgrades.
  • Added various server-side stability fixes.

UI

  • Adjusted round UI limit to 999 from 256.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: This Black Ops 6 The Replacer Video Is Maybe The Best And Funniest Yet
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/this-black-ops-6-the-replacer-video-is-maybe-the-best-and-funniest-yet/1100-6527545/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Activision has released the latest in its "Replacer" line of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 ads, and this one is maybe the best and funniest yet. If you're just catching up, Peter Stormare plays a character called The Replacer; he's the guy who replaces you because you're too busy playing Call of Duty.

In this newest spot, The Replacer fills in for Tonya on Jeopardy, before having a hilarious exchange with Jeopardy host Ken Jennings that culminates in The Replacer replacing Jennings. It's good stuff, riffing on Saturday Night Live's popular series of Jeopardy spoofs with a contestant messing with the host.

Activision has created more than two dozen of these Replacer ads for Black Ops 6, featuring Stormare replacing all manner of people, including TV hosts, the Pope, the NFL's Kyler Murray, boxer Canelo Alvarez, podcast host Joe Rogan, and political analysts. You can see all the spots on the Call of Duty YouTube page.

Stormare's The Replacer debuted in 2013 and has been a mainstay for Activision's Black Ops marketing campaigns over the years. The first in the series of commercials for Black Ops 6 featuring The Replacer went live during NFL matchups back in September.

The Replacer has even replaced an in-game Call of Duty: Warzone character, Graves, prompting some to believe he could actually be released in the game sometime down the road. It remains to be seen if that will happen, however.

Black Ops 6 launched on October 25 and was a quick success. The game welcomed the fan-favorite multiplayer map Nuketown today, November 1. Looking ahead, Black Ops 6 Season 1 begins on November 14, and this also includes the introduction of Call of Duty: Warzone's newest map, Area 99.

For more, you can check out GameSpot's Black Ops 6 campaign, multiplayer, and Zombies reviews.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Here's Everything Coming In Final Fantasy XVI's 7.1 Crossroads Update Very Soon
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/heres-everything-coming-in-final-fantasy-xvis-7-1-crossroads-update-very-soon/1100-6527543/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Final Fantasy XIV's patch 7.1 update, Crossroads, will launch on November 12 and it features a hefty amount of new content.

The new Crossroads main scenario quest involves the Warrior of Light and their companions as they seek help the people of two worlds move forward. The game's first raid is a crossover with Final Fantasy XI called "Echoes of Vana'diel - Jeuno: The First Walk and will allow for 24-player battle content. There's also a new dungeon called "Yuweyawata Field Station," a new trial called "The Minstel's Ballad: Sphene's Burden," and a new eight-player ultimate raid called "Futures Rewritten."

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: FINAL FANTASY XIV - Patch 7.1" Crossroads" Preview Trailer

For those who fancy a challenge, Chaotic Alliance Raids will be introduced. These are harder versions of existing alliance raids. One week after the subsequent sub-patch 7.15 is released, the "Cloud of Darkness (Chaotic)" raid will launch. Unreal trials are older trials scaled up to the max level, and the new one is "The Jade Stoa."

There will also be a new update to the Hall of the Novice, a series of basic training tutorials for the game's combat mechanics. The update will add a variety of new exercises and challenges.

Crossroads is Final Fantasy XIV's first story patch since the Dawntrail expansion launched back in July on PC, PlayStation, and Xbox. The game's popularity has kept it online for over a decade, and its recent release on Xbox has Square Enix now considering bringing more games to Microsoft's platform in the future.

Patch 7.1

  • Main Scenario Quests - Crossroads
  • New Alliance Raid - Echoes of Vana'diel - Jeuno: The First Walk
  • New Dungeon - Yuweyawata Field Station
  • New Trial - The Minstrel's Ballad: Sphene's Burden
  • New Ultimate Raid - Futures Rewritten (Ultimate) (Patch 7.11)
  • Chaotic Alliance Raid - Cloud of Darkness (Chaotic) (One Week after Patch 7.15)
  • New Unreal Trial - The Jade Stoa (Unreal)
  • Allied Society Quests - Pelupelu
  • Inconceivably Further Hildibrand Adventures (Patch 7.15)
  • Custom Deliveries - Nitowikwe (Patch 7.15)
  • Role Quests (Patch 7.16)
  • Wachumeqimeqi Quests (Patch 7.15)
  • Hall of the Novice Update
  • Housing Update
  • Doman Mahjong Update
  • New PvP Gear
  • New Mounts, Minions, and Emotes
George Yang on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
